7.28.19  3:27 pm   i mean, you must have to deal with ordinary things while deeply into a long creative endeavor.  People who like, want to go out to lunch, but you really are right in the middle of this very small but important detail that needs to be just right before you can even think about taking a break, and it could be hours.

7.28.19  8:37 am   do you have any advice for an aspiring musician who's a little worried about the financial side of 'trying to make a living from music'?

      i'm a little worried that if i try to put all my eggs in one basket it won't work out and i'll be kinda stranded,

      but at the same time i'm not sure that i'd be able to balance having a more stable career and also doing music work,

      so it feels like i'm kinda stuck no matter what i do, and i figured you might be able to help as someone who's (probably) had to make the same decision
7.28.19  6:15 am   What's you main source of income?

7.28.19  5:34 am   7.27.19  9:46 pm you mentioned on some interview you did recently (at least i think it was recent, it was on twitch and they don't keep stuff up on there long), you advised pretending to be as successful as you want to be/act like you have the audience you want to have, which i think can be summed up as "Fake It Til You Make It". what do you think? thanks for the other tips btw, but what if my own tastes are really niche?

      i definitely want to make stuff i personally would enjoy, but i want my stuff to be enjoyed by as many people as possible, and i'm definitely not most people. it's a good start though, i think i'll begin the "Make Content For You" diet right....now!
